page.title: 20HOPES FOR THE FUTURE,CREDITS
page.content:
The people we interviewed felt that the area in general needed a greater police presence to control vandalism, and more facilities, particularly for the young and elderly. Most people hoped that employment prospects would improve soon, leading to greater prosperity, particularly in the Kingstanding area of the block.
Two schools co-operated on this project, Kingsland Primary N.C. and Maryvale R.C. Primary. The classes involved were Class 2, aged 10, and their teacher Miss M. Dalby, with the help of Mrs R. Caro, Mrs J. Clark and Mr Penman the headmaster; Class 8, aged 11, and their teacher Miss S. Kelly, with the help of Mrs A. Hazlewood, Miss F. Kelly and Mr Sherlock the headmaster.
